Tucson nodds, and first turns to Talon before entering the room where Rodim=
us was slowly slipping away.  He smiles to her, gently running a hand over =
her face, and gives her a kiss on the cheek, letting her know that no matte=
r what happened, his love for her would never die.

"There will be a lot mo=
re where that came from after I help Rodimus. I promise you, I will not lea=
ve you, that is my promise to you Talon."

He gently rubs her hands and the=
n turns to the door, and turns an ear over to the others.

"I'm sorry, but =
I'm the only one who can enter the room.  Take heart, this is for the best,=
 and I know it will help Rodimus immensely.  Something inside me is telling=
 me so."

He enters the room and gets his bearings so is not to knock anyth=
ing over or trip over anyone.  His sensors quickly leading him to Rodimus a=
s he finds his way over to where he lies.  He then nods to Stanton and the =
others.

"All right, tell me what I have to do and I will do it."

He turns=
 his head toward Rodimus.

"Hang in there Rodimus, I'm comming.  I promised=
 to save you and I will save you."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston =

> <OLD>

> > Tucson raises a brow af=
ter hearing Silverbolt's encouraging words.
> >
> > " I can't hide anything=
 can I? A good friend always knows what his comrade is thinking, and no mat=
ter how saddened one is, he can always feel good that he has friends standi=
ng beside him. It's very good to know I have you and the others for support=
. I should consider myself very lucky to be a part of a powerful merger of =
factions. Now, Rodimus's health is declining, and I have more than enough s=
park to share. I think it is time that you allow me to attempt a form of en=
ergy transfusion. It may be his only hope of recovery."
>

verbolt turned to face Tuscon a look of surprise crossing across
> his expr=
essive features as he nodded at Tuscon, "Those of valor must
> act as one."=
 he said. "I heard the cracking of your knuckes and I know
> why we are her=
e, and I know whoes black energon pump is behind this."
> Silverbolt's opti=
cs darkened as he turned back to look at Rodimus
> through the glass as the=
 alarm went off.

 Legacy.

ng so diligantly on saving Rodimus Prime, and now it is my turn to give som=
ething back in exchange for the undaunting dedication you are showing our f=
actions. My spark has more than enough power to transfuse energy from my bo=
dy into his. Not to worry, I will not go off line. It may be our only hope =
of saving Rodimus Prime. It is not a request, it is my order."

noyed to have been pulled away from these delicate proceedures by

 Everyone knew well the folly of trying to order a medical

 own bay. But then Santon smiled slightly and nodded,

eed you . . . but only you. Step inside."

 work on Rodimus, even as Rodimus' life
